CVE-2024-21683
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2024-06-04T15:32:02

11 posts

This High severity RCE (Remote Code Execution) vulnerability was introduced in version 5.2 of Confluence Data Center and Server. This RCE (Remote Code Execution) vulnerability, with a CVSS Score of 8.3, allows an authenticated attacker to execute arbitrary code which has high impact to confidentiality, high impact to integrity, high impact to availability, and requires no user interaction.  Atla

Nuclei template

5 repos

https://github.com/absholi7ly/-CVE-2024-21683-RCE-in-Confluence-Data-Center-and-Server

https://github.com/xh4vm/CVE-2024-21683

https://github.com/phucrio/CVE-2024-21683-RCE

https://github.com/W01fh4cker/CVE-2024-21683-RCE

https://github.com/r00t7oo2jm/-CVE-2024-21683-RCE-in-Confluence-Data-Center-and-Server

jbhall56 at 2024-06-05T12:01:55.373Z ##

Tracked as CVE-2024-21683 (CVSS score of 8.3), the remote code execution (RCE) bug is rooted in the input validation mechanism of the function that allows users to add a new code block macro language definition. https://www.securityweek.com/details-of-atlassian-confluence-rce-vulnerability-disclosed/

##
jbhall56 at 2024-06-04T11:36:45.115Z ##

The vulnerability, identified as CVE-2024-21683, has a high CVSS score of 8.3 out of 10, and allows an authenticated threat actor the ability to execute arbitrary code. https://www.darkreading.com/vulnerabilities-threats/atlassian-confluence-high-severity-bug-allows-code-execution

##
jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-06-03T09:55:03.000Z ##

High-risk Atlassian Confluence RCE fixed, PoC available (CVE-2024-21683) https://www.helpnetsecurity.com/2024/06/03/cve-2024-21683-poc/ #AtlassianConfluence #vulnerability #Don'tmiss #SonicWall #Hotstuff #News #CVE #PoC

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-24T20:12:39.143Z ##

Proof of concept released for CVE-2024-21683 (8.3 high) for a remote code execution in Atlassian Confluence:

  • Patch diffing: https://realalphaman.substack.com/p/quick-note-about-cve-2024-21683-authenticated
  • Proof of Concept and Weaponized exploit: https://github.com/W01fh4cker/CVE-2024-21683-RCE
##
psytester at 2024-05-24T14:26:53.605Z ##

@heisec
Falsche Zusammenfassung der aktuellen Lücken

Die CVE-2024-21683 mit seiner RCE ist wohl nicht schlimm genug um kritisch zu sein?
Ok, es ist der Admin Endpoint in der App Verwaltung betroffen
/admin/plugins/........
aber die Ausnutzung ist dann sehr simpel.

##
jbhall56@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-05T12:01:55.000Z ##

Tracked as CVE-2024-21683 (CVSS score of 8.3), the remote code execution (RCE) bug is rooted in the input validation mechanism of the function that allows users to add a new code block macro language definition. https://www.securityweek.com/details-of-atlassian-confluence-rce-vulnerability-disclosed/

##
jbhall56@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-04T11:36:45.000Z ##

The vulnerability, identified as CVE-2024-21683, has a high CVSS score of 8.3 out of 10, and allows an authenticated threat actor the ability to execute arbitrary code. https://www.darkreading.com/vulnerabilities-threats/atlassian-confluence-high-severity-bug-allows-code-execution

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-24T20:12:39.000Z ##

Proof of concept released for CVE-2024-21683 (8.3 high) for a remote code execution in Atlassian Confluence:

  • Patch diffing: https://realalphaman.substack.com/p/quick-note-about-cve-2024-21683-authenticated

##
psytester@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-22T21:42:45.000Z ##

CVE-2024-21683 Atlassian Confluence RCE exploit is already out.
Credit goes to Huong Kieu
https://twitter.com/realalphaman_
and his writeup https://realalphaman.substack.com/p/quick-note-about-cve-2024-21683-authenticated

Fortunately, this is an admin endpoint
/admin/plugins/newcode/addlanguage.action
but payload is really very simple as javascript file content.

##

CVE-2024-29972
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2024-06-04T03:30:51

6 posts

** UNSUPPORTED WHEN ASSIGNED ** The command injection vulnerability in the CGI program "remote_help-cgi" in Zyxel NAS326 firmware versions before V5.21(AAZF.17)C0 and NAS542 firmware versions before V5.21(ABAG.14)C0 could allow an unauthenticated attacker to execute some operating system (OS) commands by sending a crafted HTTP POST request.

threatcodex at 2024-06-05T13:26:43.543Z ##

Five new vulnerabilities found in Zyxel NAS devices (including code execution and privilege escalation)
#CVE_2024_29972 #CVE_2024_29976 #CVE_2024_29973 #CVE_2024_29975 #CVE_2024_29974
https://outpost24.com/blog/zyxel-nas-critical-vulnerabilities/

##
threatcodex@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-05T13:26:43.000Z ##

Five new vulnerabilities found in Zyxel NAS devices (including code execution and privilege escalation)
#CVE_2024_29972 #CVE_2024_29976 #CVE_2024_29973 #CVE_2024_29975 #CVE_2024_29974
https://outpost24.com/blog/zyxel-nas-critical-vulnerabilities/

##
screaminggoat at 2024-06-04T18:51:44.561Z ##

Outpost24: Five new vulnerabilities found in Zyxel NAS devices (including code execution and privilege escalation)
Outpost24 provided vulnerability details and proofs of concept for five Zyxel NAS vulnerabilities:

  • CVE-2024-29972 (9.8 critical) command injection vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-29973 (9.8 critical) command injection vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-29974 (9.8 critical) remote code execution vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-29975 (6.7 medium) improper privilege management vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-29976 (6.5 medium) improper privilege management vulnerability

Zyxel has treated the disclosure process fairly, agreeing to a coordinated disclosure. Despite the fact that the device has reached End-of-Life by the end of last year, they still released patches for the three critical vulnerabilities CVE-2024-29972, CVE-2024-29973, and CVE-2024-29974. Furthermore, as the device has reached End-of-Life, they decided to remove the "Remote Support" account "NsaRescueAngel".

h/t: @BleepingComputer Zyxel issues emergency RCE patch for end-of-life NAS devices

#CVE #Zyxel #vulnerability #proofofconcept

##

CVE-2024-29974
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2024-06-04T03:30:51

6 posts

** UNSUPPORTED WHEN ASSIGNED ** The remote code execution vulnerability in the CGI program “file_upload-cgi” in Zyxel NAS326 firmware versions before V5.21(AAZF.17)C0 and NAS542 firmware versions before V5.21(ABAG.14)C0 could allow an unauthenticated attacker to execute arbitrary code by uploading a crafted configuration file to a vulnerable device.

CVE-2024-29976
(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2024-06-04T03:30:51

4 posts

** UNSUPPORTED WHEN ASSIGNED ** The improper privilege management vulnerability in the command “show_allsessions” in Zyxel NAS326 firmware versions before V5.21(AAZF.17)C0 and NAS542 firmware versions before V5.21(ABAG.14)C0 could allow an authenticated attacker to obtain a logged-in administrator’s session information containing cookies on an affected device.

(6.7 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-06-04T03:30:46

4 posts

** UNSUPPORTED WHEN ASSIGNED ** The improper privilege management vulnerability in the SUID executable binary in Zyxel NAS326 firmware versions before V5.21(AAZF.17)C0 and NAS542 firmware versions before V5.21(ABAG.14)C0 could allow an authenticated local attacker with administrator privileges to execute some system commands as the “root” user on a vulnerable device.

##

CVE-2017-3506
(7.4 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2024-06-04T01:00:01.837000

18 posts

Vulnerability in the Oracle WebLogic Server component of Oracle Fusion Middleware (subcomponent: Web Services). Supported versions that are affected are 10.3.6.0, 12.1.3.0, 12.2.1.0, 12.2.1.1 and 12.2.1.2. Difficult to exploit vulnerability allows unauthenticated attacker with network access via HTTP to compromise Oracle WebLogic Server. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in unaut

3 repos

https://github.com/0xn0ne/weblogicScanner

https://github.com/Al1ex/CVE-2017-3506

https://github.com/ianxtianxt/CVE-2017-3506

screaminggoat at 2024-06-03T14:30:52.891Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds One Known Exploited Vulnerability to Catalog
Hot off the press! CISA adds CVE-2017-3506 (7.4 high) Oracle WebLogic Server OS Command Injection Vulnerability to the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) Catalog based on evidence of active exploitation.

Shoutout to @hrbrmstr for the KEV Catalog RSS feed https://github.com/hrbrmstr/kev-push

#CVE_2017_3506 #Oracle #Weblogic #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #CISA #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiiesCatalog

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-30T13:30:30.566Z ##

Trend Micro: Decoding Water Sigbin's Latest Obfuscation Tricks
Trend Micro writes about the 8220 gang, a Chinese financially motivated threat actor group known for deploying cryptominers in cloud-based environments and Linux servers. They write about the exploitation of Oracle WebLogic vulnerabilities CVE-2017-3506 (7.4 high) and CVE-2023-21839 (7.5 high) to deploy a cryptocurrency miner via a PowerShell script. They provide an analysis of the bat file. IOC and MITRE ATT&CK TTPs provided.

#8220gang #WaterSigbin #threatintel #cryptominer #IOC #CVE_2017_3506 #CVE_2023_21839

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-03T14:30:52.000Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds One Known Exploited Vulnerability to Catalog
Hot off the press! CISA adds CVE-2017-3506 (7.4 high) Oracle WebLogic Server OS Command Injection Vulnerability to the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) Catalog based on evidence of active exploitation.

Shoutout to @hrbrmstr for the KEV Catalog RSS feed https://github.com/hrbrmstr/kev-push

#CVE_2017_3506 #Oracle #Weblogic #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #CISA #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiiesCatalog

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-30T13:30:30.000Z ##

Trend Micro: Decoding Water Sigbin's Latest Obfuscation Tricks
Trend Micro writes about the 8220 gang, a Chinese financially motivated threat actor group known for deploying cryptominers in cloud-based environments and Linux servers. They write about the exploitation of Oracle WebLogic vulnerabilities CVE-2017-3506 (7.4 high) and CVE-2023-21839 (7.5 high) to deploy a cryptocurrency miner via a PowerShell script. They provide an analysis of the bat file. IOC and MITRE ATT&CK TTPs provided.

#8220gang #WaterSigbin #threatintel #cryptominer #IOC #CVE_2017_3506 #CVE_2023_21839

##

Trend Micro: Decoding Water Sigbin's Latest Obfuscation Tricks
Trend Micro writes about the 8220 gang, a Chinese financially motivated threat actor group known for deploying cryptominers in cloud-based environments and Linux servers. They write about the exploitation of Oracle WebLogic vulnerabilities CVE-2017-3506 (7.4 high) and CVE-2023-21839 (7.5 high) to deploy a cryptocurrency miner via a PowerShell script. ##
Sempf at 2024-06-05T03:40:33.721Z ##

CISA added a seven (!) year old bug in Weblogic to the KEV list.

https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-3506

Now, I know instant patching is not in the cards, and that's ok, but seven years? Comeon man.

#security #oracle #cisa

##
screaminggoat at 2024-06-04T15:45:55.536Z ##

@campuscodi On 30 May 2024, Trend Micro reported that the Chinese financially motivated threat actor group 8220 Gang (who they call Water Sigbin) exploited the vulnerabilities CVE-2017-3506 and CVE-2023-21839 to deploy a cryptocurrency miner via a PowerShell script: https://www.trendmicro.com/en_us/research/24/e/decoding-8220-latest-obfuscation-tricks.html

##
campuscodi@mastodon.social at 2024-06-04T15:40:04.000Z ##

CISA has updated its KEV database with a new vulnerability currently actively exploited in the wild, a 2017 Oracle WebLogic command injection tracked as CVE-2017-3506.

Changes this is used for crypto-mining... over 90% :nigmathink:

https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2024/06/03/cisa-adds-one-known-exploited-vulnerability-catalog

##
jbhall56 at 2024-06-04T11:14:04.263Z ##

Tracked as CVE-2017-3506 (CVSS score: 7.4), the issue concerns an operating system (OS) command injection vulnerability that could be exploited to obtain unauthorized access to susceptible servers and take complete control. https://thehackernews.com/2024/06/oracle-weblogic-server-os-command.html

##

CVE-2024-4332(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-06-03T18:31:00

2 posts

An authentication bypass vulnerability has been identified in the REST and SOAP API components of Tripwire Enterprise (TE) 9.1.0 when TE is configured to use LDAP/Active Directory SAML authentication and its optional "Auto-synchronize LDAP Users, Roles, and Groups" feature is enabled. This vulnerability allows unauthenticated attackers to bypass authentication if a valid username is known. Exploit

screaminggoat at 2024-06-05T16:05:13.190Z ##

Fortra security advisory: Improper Authentication in Tripwire Enterprise 9.1 APIs
CVE-2024-4332 (9.8 critical, disclosed 03 June 2024) authentication bypass vulnerability in REST and SOAP API components of Tripwire Enterprise (TE) 9.1.0. This vulnerability allows unauthenticated attackers to bypass authentication if a valid username is known. Exploitation of this vulnerability could allow remote attackers to gain privileged access to the APIs and lead to unauthorized information disclosure or modification. No mention of exploitation.

#CVE_2024_4332 #Tripwire #Fortra #vulnerability #CVE

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-05T16:05:13.000Z ##

Fortra security advisory: Improper Authentication in Tripwire Enterprise 9.1 APIs
CVE-2024-4332 (9.8 critical, disclosed 03 June 2024) authentication bypass vulnerability in REST and SOAP API components of Tripwire Enterprise (TE) 9.1.0. This vulnerability allows unauthenticated attackers to bypass authentication if a valid username is known. Exploitation of this vulnerability could allow remote attackers to gain privileged access to the APIs and lead to unauthorized information disclosure or modification. No mention of exploitation.

#CVE_2024_4332 #Tripwire #Fortra #vulnerability #CVE

##

CVE-2020-1472
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 51.09%

updated 2024-06-02T05:06:03

2 posts

An elevation of privilege vulnerability exists when an attacker establishes a vulnerable Netlogon secure channel connection to a domain controller, using the Netlogon Remote Protocol (MS-NRPC), aka 'Netlogon Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability'.

screaminggoat at 2024-06-05T13:18:55.993Z ##

Symantec: RansomHub: New Ransomware has Origins in Older Knight
Symantec assesses that RansomHub Ransomware-as-a-Service (RaaS) is very likely an updated and rebranded version of the older Knight ransomware. Analysis of the RansomHub payload by Symantec revealed a high degree of similarity between the two threats. RansomHub attackers gain initial access by exploiting the Zerologon vulnerability CVE-2020-1472 (10.0 Critical, disclosed 17 August 2020, added to KEV Catalog 03 November 2021) IOC provided.

#zerologon #threatintel #IOC #ransomhub #Knightransomware #ransomware

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-05T13:18:55.000Z ##

Symantec: RansomHub: New Ransomware has Origins in Older Knight
Symantec assesses that RansomHub Ransomware-as-a-Service (RaaS) is very likely an updated and rebranded version of the older Knight ransomware. Analysis of the RansomHub payload by Symantec revealed a high degree of similarity between the two threats. RansomHub attackers gain initial access by exploiting the Zerologon vulnerability CVE-2020-1472 (10.0 Critical, disclosed 17 August 2020, added to KEV Catalog 03 November 2021) IOC provided.

CVE-2024-29829
(8.4 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2024-05-31T18:31:23

2 posts

An unspecified SQL Injection vulnerability in Core server of Ivanti EPM 2022 SU5 and prior allows an authenticated attacker within the same network to execute arbitrary code.

adulau at 2024-05-24T04:36:26.278Z ##

KB Security Advisory Ivanti Endpoint Manager (EPM) May 2024

An unspecified SQL Injection vulnerability in Core server of Ivanti EPM 2022 SU5 and prior allows an unauthenticated attacker within the same network to execute arbitrary code.

It's actually 10 SQL Injections....

The good news, it's documented.

Six of the 10 vulnerabilities – from CVE-2024-29822 through CVE-2024-29827 (CVSS scores: 9.6) – relate to SQL injection flaws that allow an unauthenticated attacker within the same network to execute arbitrary code. https://thehackernews.com/2024/05/ivanti-patches-critical-remote-code.html

https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/KB-Security-Advisory-EPM-May-2024?language=en_US

#ivanti #vulnerability #vulnerabilities #infosec

adulau@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-24T04:36:26.000Z ##

An unspecified SQL Injection vulnerability in Core server of Ivanti EPM 2022 SU5 and prior allows an unauthenticated attacker within the same network to execute arbitrary code.

It's actually 10 SQL Injections....

##
jbhall56@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-23T12:39:24.000Z ##

Six of the 10 vulnerabilities – from CVE-2024-29822 through CVE-2024-29827 (CVSS scores: 9.6) – relate to SQL injection flaws that allow an unauthenticated attacker within the same network to execute arbitrary code. https://thehackernews.com/2024/05/ivanti-patches-critical-remote-code.html

##

CVE-2024-22058
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-05-31T18:31:16

2 posts

A buffer overflow allows a low privilege user on the local machine that has the EPM Agent installed to execute arbitrary code with elevated permissions in Ivanti EPM 2021.1 and older.

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat at 2024-05-29T16:26:49.587Z ##

Ivanti security advisory: CVE-2024-22058 Privilege Escalation for Ivanti Endpoint Manager (EPM)
CVE-2024-22058 (7.8 high) buffer overflow to arbitrary code execution with elevated permissions in Ivanti EPM 2021.1 SU5 and older. EPM 2022 and later are not impacted. The vulnerability affects legacy Remote Control, which is not included in EPM 2022 forward.

We are not aware of any customers being exploited by this vulnerability at the time of disclosure.

#CVE_2024_22058 #Ivanti #EPM #vulnerability #CVE

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-29T16:26:49.000Z ##

Ivanti security advisory: CVE-2024-22058 Privilege Escalation for Ivanti Endpoint Manager (EPM)
CVE-2024-22058 (7.8 high) buffer overflow to arbitrary code execution with elevated permissions in Ivanti EPM 2021.1 SU5 and older. EPM 2022 and later are not impacted. The vulnerability affects legacy Remote Control, which is not included in EPM 2022 forward.

We are not aware of any customers being exploited by this vulnerability at the time of disclosure.

#CVE_2024_22058 #Ivanti #EPM #vulnerability #CVE

##

CVE-2024-24919
(8.6 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2024-05-31T16:04:09.703000

83 posts

Potentially allowing an attacker to read certain information on Check Point Security Gateways once connected to the internet and enabled with remote Access VPN or Mobile Access Software Blades. A Security fix that mitigates this vulnerability is available.

Nuclei template

##
screaminggoat at 2024-06-04T21:41:19.410Z ##

GreyNoise: What’s Going on With Check Point (CVE-2024-24919)?
@iagox86 of GreyNoise provides observations of exploitation attempts for CVE-2024-24919 (see parent toots above for additional information on the exploited zero-day). This includes attacker IP, date/time of attempts, and payload information.

#threatintel #checkpoint #CVE_2024_24919 #activeexploitation #zeroday #eitw #IOC

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-31T14:31:33.304Z ##

One of the IP addresses in the IOC provided by Check Point (see parent toot above) 156.146.56.136 was previously reported by Volexity in Zero-Day Exploitation of Atlassian Confluence (02 June 2022). CVE-2022-26134 (9.8 critical, disclosed 02 June 2022 by Atlassian as an exploited zero-day) Confluence Data Center and Server RCE was exploited by likely Chinese actors:

Volexity has reason to believe this exploit is currently in use by multiple threat actors and that the likely country of origin of these attackers is China.

There is a very likely link to Chinese threat actors based on the zero-day exploitation of a VPN. Following Cisco's reporting of ArcaneDoor campaign by state-sponsored actors (likely China) on 24 April 2024. cc: @campuscodi @hrbrmstr @zeljkazorz

#CVE_2024_24919 #activeexploitation #eitw #CheckPoint #VPN #IOC #threatintel #China #cyberespionage

##
cyberlibrarian at 2024-05-31T14:29:52.604Z ##

If you have a #CheckPoint firewall with Remote Access VPN etc, you may already be exploited. #CVE_2024_24919 #CVE-2024-24919

With the public availability of #exploit code, exploitation and scanning began overnight. Given how trivial exploitation is, your /etc/shadow is likely stolen and perhaps other files (LDAP secrets).

I would also note that I found the Check Point's IPS rule for this is not reliable. My own exploitation tests were not detected by IPS, but others were. You cannot rely on these logs to conclude you were NOT exploited.

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-31T13:01:01.540Z ##

Check Point 31 May 2024 update: Preventative Hotfix for CVE-2024-24919 - Quantum Gateway Information Disclosure

When were exploitation attempts for this vulnerability first seen?
Our retrospective telemetry analysis shows exploitation attempts starting on April 30, 2024. Further investigation (as of May 31st) revealed that the first exploitation attempts started on April 7, 2024. We are actively investigating further.

Check Point also provided 51 IP address/ranges that are indicators of compromise (suspect IP addresses used by threat actors to exploit the vulnerability) h/t @zeljkazorz

#CVE_2024_24919 #CVE #kev #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA #activeexploitation #eitw #CheckPoint #VPN #IOC #threatintel

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-30T20:42:43.560Z ##

Rapid: CVE-2024-24919: Check Point Security Gateway Information Disclosure
Rapid7 warns of CVE-2024-24919 information disclosure vulnerability affecting Check Point Security Gateway. They describe the Check Point security advisory, Mnemonic threat advisory (contains IOC), watchTowr's vulnerability analysis, and that CVE-2024-24919 was added to CISA's KEV Catalog. All of these are linked in the parent toots above. Rapid7 points out what successful web administration panel and SSH logins would appear as in log events. Curiously, they forgot to mention the identified IPs from mnemonic's blog.

#CVE_2024_24919 #CVE #kev #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA #activeexploitation #eitw #CheckPoint #VPN #IOC

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-30T15:56:23.104Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds Two Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog

  • CVE-2024-24919 (8.6 high) Check Point Quantum Security Gateways Information Disclosure Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-1086 (7.8 high) Linux Kernel Use-After-Free Vulnerability

#CVE_2024_1086 #CVE_2024_24919 #CVE #kev #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA #activeexploitation #eitw #CheckPoint #VPN #Linux

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-30T03:02:05.144Z ##

watchTowr: Check Point - Wrong Check Point (CVE-2024-24919)
This is beyond words. watchTowr patch diffed CVE-2024-24919 and confirmed that this is a path traversal (cc: @reverseics) leading to arbitrary file read. This is much more severe and deserves a critical CVSSv3 score. cc: @wdormann

#zeroday #CVE_2024_24919 #eitw #activeexploitation #VPN #CheckPoint #vulnerability #cve #threatintel #IOC

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-29T18:58:48.170Z ##

Mnemonic has observed attacker exploitation of CVE-2024-294919 as a zero-day (see above parent toot) since at least 30 April 2024:

mnemonic has observed attempts of exploitation in customer environments since April 30, 2024.

The following IOCs have been observed in customer environments between April 30, 2024, and today (May 29, 2024):

  • Reconnaissance IP: 82.180.133[.]120
  • Exploitation IP: 87.120.8[.]173
  • Exploitation IP: 23.227.203[.]36
  • Exploitation IP: 203.160.68[.]12

#zeroday #CVE_2024_24919 #eitw #activeexploitation #VPN #CheckPoint #vulnerability #cve #threatintel #IOC

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-29T16:01:38.064Z ##

mnemonic: Advisory: Active exploitation of Check Point Remote Access VPN vulnerability (CVE-2024-24919)
mnemonic has several observations of the exploit being used in the wild. The vulnerability is particularly critical because it does not require any user interaction or privileges, making it easy to exploit remotely.

The vulnerability allows a threat actor to enumerate and extract password hashes for all local accounts, including the account used to connect to Active Directory. The full extent of the consequences is still unknown. However, it is known that password hashes of legacy local users with password-only authentication can be extracted, including service accounts used to connect to Active Directory. Weak passwords can be compromised, leading to further misuse and potential lateral movement within the network.

h/t: @Chocobo

#zeroday #CVE_2024_24919 #eitw #activeexploitation #VPN #CheckPoint #vulnerability #cve

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-04T21:41:19.000Z ##

The vulnerability allows a threat actor to enumerate and extract password hashes for all local accounts, including the account used to connect to Active Directory. The full extent of the consequences is still unknown. However, it is known that password hashes of legacy local users with password-only authentication can be extracted, including service accounts used to connect to Active Directory. Weak passwords can be compromised, leading to further misuse and potential lateral movement within the network.

h/t: @Chocobo

#zeroday #CVE_2024_24919 #eitw #activeexploitation #VPN #CheckPoint #vulnerability #cve

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-29T12:19:53.000Z ##

Check Point: Attempted Zero-Day Exploitation: Important Security Update – Stay Protected Against VPN Information Disclosure (CVE-2024-24919)
Check Point warned on Monday 27 May 2024 of attacker attempts to gain unauthorized access to VPN products. They identified login attempts using old VPN local-accounts relying on unrecommended password-only authentication method. Check Point officially disclosed a sensitive information disclosure vulnerability tracked as CVE-2024-24919 (7.5 high):

Potentially allowing an attacker to read certain information on Check Point Security Gateways once connected to the internet and enabled with remote Access VPN or Mobile Access Software Blades. A Security fix that mitigates this vulnerability is available.

This affects CloudGuard Network, Quantum Maestro, Quantum Scalable Chassis, Quantum Security Gateways, Quantum Spark Appliances versions: R80.20.x, R80.20SP (EOL), R80.40 (EOL), R81, R81.10, R81.10.x, R81.20

View the following fix: Preventative Hotfix for CVE-2024-24919 - Quantum Gateway Information Disclosure

h/t to @serghei and @BleepingComputer for their initial news article. cc: @briankrebs @campuscodi @mttaggart @deepthoughts10 @dangoodin

#zeroday #CVE_2024_24919 #eitw #activeexploitation #VPN #CheckPoint #vulnerability #cve

##
threatcodex at 2024-06-05T15:26:30.951Z ##

What’s Going on With Check Point (CVE-2024-24919)?
#CVE_2024_24919
https://www.greynoise.io/blog/whats-going-on-with-checkpoint-cve-2024-24919

##
screaminggoat at 2024-06-04T21:41:19.410Z ##

GreyNoise: What’s Going on With Check Point (CVE-2024-24919)?
@iagox86 of GreyNoise provides observations of exploitation attempts for CVE-2024-24919 (see parent toots above for additional information on the exploited zero-day). This includes attacker IP, date/time of attempts, and payload information.

#threatintel #checkpoint #CVE_2024_24919 #activeexploitation #zeroday #eitw #IOC

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-31T14:31:33.304Z ##

One of the IP addresses in the IOC provided by Check Point (see parent toot above) 156.146.56.136 was previously reported by Volexity in Zero-Day Exploitation of Atlassian Confluence (02 June 2022). CVE-2022-26134 (9.8 critical, disclosed 02 June 2022 by Atlassian as an exploited zero-day) Confluence Data Center and Server RCE was exploited by likely Chinese actors:

Volexity has reason to believe this exploit is currently in use by multiple threat actors and that the likely country of origin of these attackers is China.

There is a very likely link to Chinese threat actors based on the zero-day exploitation of a VPN. Following Cisco's reporting of ArcaneDoor campaign by state-sponsored actors (likely China) on 24 April 2024. cc: @campuscodi @hrbrmstr @zeljkazorz

#CVE_2024_24919 #activeexploitation #eitw #CheckPoint #VPN #IOC #threatintel #China #cyberespionage

##
cyberlibrarian at 2024-05-31T14:29:52.604Z ##

If you have a #CheckPoint firewall with Remote Access VPN etc, you may already be exploited. #CVE_2024_24919 #CVE-2024-24919

With the public availability of #exploit code, exploitation and scanning began overnight. Given how trivial exploitation is, your /etc/shadow is likely stolen and perhaps other files (LDAP secrets).

I would also note that I found the Check Point's IPS rule for this is not reliable. My own exploitation tests were not detected by IPS, but others were. You cannot rely on these logs to conclude you were NOT exploited.

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-31T13:01:01.540Z ##

Check Point 31 May 2024 update: Preventative Hotfix for CVE-2024-24919 - Quantum Gateway Information Disclosure

When were exploitation attempts for this vulnerability first seen?
Our retrospective telemetry analysis shows exploitation attempts starting on April 30, 2024. Further investigation (as of May 31st) revealed that the first exploitation attempts started on April 7, 2024. We are actively investigating further.

Check Point also provided 51 IP address/ranges that are indicators of compromise (suspect IP addresses used by threat actors to exploit the vulnerability) h/t @zeljkazorz

#CVE_2024_24919 #CVE #kev #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA #activeexploitation #eitw #CheckPoint #VPN #IOC #threatintel

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-30T20:42:43.560Z ##

Rapid: CVE-2024-24919: Check Point Security Gateway Information Disclosure
Rapid7 warns of CVE-2024-24919 information disclosure vulnerability affecting Check Point Security Gateway. They describe the Check Point security advisory, Mnemonic threat advisory (contains IOC), watchTowr's vulnerability analysis, and that CVE-2024-24919 was added to CISA's KEV Catalog. All of these are linked in the parent toots above. Rapid7 points out what successful web administration panel and SSH logins would appear as in log events. Curiously, they forgot to mention the identified IPs from mnemonic's blog.

#CVE_2024_24919 #CVE #kev #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA #activeexploitation #eitw #CheckPoint #VPN #IOC

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-30T15:56:23.104Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds Two Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog

  • CVE-2024-24919 (8.6 high) Check Point Quantum Security Gateways Information Disclosure Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-1086 (7.8 high) Linux Kernel Use-After-Free Vulnerability

#CVE_2024_1086 #CVE_2024_24919 #CVE #kev #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA #activeexploitation #eitw #CheckPoint #VPN #Linux

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-30T03:02:05.144Z ##

watchTowr: Check Point - Wrong Check Point (CVE-2024-24919)
This is beyond words. watchTowr patch diffed CVE-2024-24919 and confirmed that this is a path traversal (cc: @reverseics) leading to arbitrary file read. This is much more severe and deserves a critical CVSSv3 score. cc: @wdormann

#zeroday #CVE_2024_24919 #eitw #activeexploitation #VPN #CheckPoint #vulnerability #cve #threatintel #IOC

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-29T18:58:48.170Z ##

Mnemonic has observed attacker exploitation of CVE-2024-294919 as a zero-day (see above parent toot) since at least 30 April 2024:

mnemonic has observed attempts of exploitation in customer environments since April 30, 2024.

The following IOCs have been observed in customer environments between April 30, 2024, and today (May 29, 2024):

  • Reconnaissance IP: 82.180.133[.]120
  • Exploitation IP: 87.120.8[.]173
  • Exploitation IP: 23.227.203[.]36
  • Exploitation IP: 203.160.68[.]12

#zeroday #CVE_2024_24919 #eitw #activeexploitation #VPN #CheckPoint #vulnerability #cve #threatintel #IOC

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-29T16:01:38.064Z ##

mnemonic: Advisory: Active exploitation of Check Point Remote Access VPN vulnerability (CVE-2024-24919)
mnemonic has several observations of the exploit being used in the wild. The vulnerability is particularly critical because it does not require any user interaction or privileges, making it easy to exploit remotely.

The vulnerability allows a threat actor to enumerate and extract password hashes for all local accounts, including the account used to connect to Active Directory. The full extent of the consequences is still unknown. However, it is known that password hashes of legacy local users with password-only authentication can be extracted, including service accounts used to connect to Active Directory. Weak passwords can be compromised, leading to further misuse and potential lateral movement within the network.

h/t: @Chocobo

#zeroday #CVE_2024_24919 #eitw #activeexploitation #VPN #CheckPoint #vulnerability #cve

Check Point: Attempted Zero-Day Exploitation: Important Security Update – Stay Protected Against VPN Information Disclosure (CVE-2024-24919)
Check Point warned on Monday 27 May 2024 of attacker attempts to gain unauthorized access to VPN products. They identified login attempts using old VPN local-accounts relying on unrecommended password-only authentication method. Check Point officially disclosed a sensitive information disclosure vulnerability tracked as CVE-2024-24919 (7.5 high):

Potentially allowing an attacker to read certain information on Check Point Security Gateways once connected to the internet and enabled with remote Access VPN or Mobile Access Software Blades. A Security fix that mitigates this vulnerability is available.

This affects CloudGuard Network, Quantum Maestro, Quantum Scalable Chassis, Quantum Security Gateways, Quantum Spark Appliances versions: R80.20.x, R80.20SP (EOL), R80.40 (EOL), R81, R81.10, R81.10.x, R81.20

https://github.com/ifconfig-me/CVE-2024-24919-Bulk-Scanner

#DarkWeb #Cybersecurity #Security #Cyberattack #Cybercrime #Privacy #Infosec

More: This Python script scans lisy of URLs for CVE-2024-24919 vulnerability by sending specific POST requests and checking the response headers and status code. It logs the request and response details and identifies vulnerable URLs based on predefined criteria.

##
pentesttools at 2024-05-31T13:18:49.309Z ##

🚨 Got an important heads-up for you: CVE-2024-24919 - the Check Point VPN path-traversal vulnerability - is a zero-day you need to be on top of. 👉 Here are 3 reasons why:

⚠️ It’s ridiculously easy to exploit because it's remote, unauthenticated, and many VPN servers are exposed on the Internet.
⚠️ The proof of concept (PoC) is already out there and it's already spread like wildfire.
⚠️ This vulnerability lets attackers read *any file* on the compromised server.

🎯 But here’s the good news: we've just integrated detection for this CVE in our Network Vulnerability Scanner! ➡️ https://pentest-tools.com/network-vulnerability-scanning/network-security-scanner-online

Take a moment to scan your servers and see if you need to deploy any updates before the weekend.

Here are the details from our vuln & exploits DB: https://pentest-tools.com/vulnerabilities-exploits/check-point-quantum-gateway-information-disclosure_22692

#penetrationtesting #ethicalhacking #cybersecurity

##
campuscodi@mastodon.social at 2024-05-30T00:23:43.000Z ##

Check Point has released a security update to patch a zero-day exploited in its VPN and security appliances.

Tracked as CVE-2024-24919, the zero-day is an information disclosure that allows threat actor to retrieve data from appliances.

https://support.checkpoint.com/results/sk/sk182336

Security firm Mnemonic says it observed threat actors use the vulnerability to enumerate and extract password hashes, including the accounts used to connect to Active Directory.

https://www.mnemonic.io/resources/blog/advisory-check-point-remote-access-vpn-vulnerability-cve-2024-24919/

This affects CloudGuard Network, Quantum Maestro, Quantum Scalable Chassis, Quantum Security Gateways, Quantum Spark Appliances versions: R80.20.x, R80.20SP (EOL), R80.40 (EOL), R81, R81.10, R81.10.x, R81.20

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-04T15:34:32.000Z ##

@rex978956 The vulnerability should be CVE-2024-24919

##
campuscodi@mastodon.social at 2024-06-01T22:30:47.000Z ##

IoT search engine Censys is seeing almost 14,000 Check Point security gateways connected to the internet: https://censys.com/cve-2024-24919/

The devices may be vulnerable to CVE-2024-24919, a zero-day in the company's devices that was patched last week: https://support.checkpoint.com/results/sk/sk182336

##
DarkWebInformer@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-01T17:36:43.000Z ##

⚠️CVE-2024-24919⚠️Check Point Security Gateway Information Disclosure.

https://github.com/ifconfig-me/CVE-2024-24919-Bulk-Scanner

#DarkWeb #Cybersecurity #Security #Cyberattack #Cybercrime #Privacy #Infosec

More: This Python script scans lisy of URLs for CVE-2024-24919 vulnerability by sending specific POST requests and checking the response headers and status code. It logs the request and response details and identifies vulnerable URLs based on predefined criteria.

https://x.com/DarkWebInformer/status/1796954051743023243

##
pentesttools@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-31T13:18:49.000Z ##

🚨 Got an important heads-up for you: CVE-2024-24919 - the Check Point VPN path-traversal vulnerability - is a zero-day you need to be on top of. 👉 Here are 3 reasons why:

⚠️ It’s ridiculously easy to exploit because it's remote, unauthenticated, and many VPN servers are exposed on the Internet.
⚠️ The proof of concept (PoC) is already out there and it's already spread like wildfire.
⚠️ This vulnerability lets attackers read *any file* on the compromised server.

🎯 But here’s the good news: we've just integrated detection for this CVE in our Network Vulnerability Scanner! ➡️ https://pentest-tools.com/network-vulnerability-scanning/network-security-scanner-online

Take a moment to scan your servers and see if you need to deploy any updates before the weekend.

Here are the details from our vuln & exploits DB: https://pentest-tools.com/vulnerabilities-exploits/check-point-quantum-gateway-information-disclosure_22692

#penetrationtesting #ethicalhacking #cybersecurity

##
zeljkazorz@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-31T12:25:03.000Z ##

Check Point says that first CVE-2024-24919 exploitation attempts started on April 7, 2024.

https://www.helpnetsecurity.com/2024/05/31/cve-2024-24919/

patchnow24x7@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-30T16:14:52.000Z ##

Urgent: Apply the Updates to Check Point VPN to mitigate CVE-2024-24919..

https://support.checkpoint.com/results/sk/sk182336

AAKL@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-30T15:35:00.000Z ##

New on #CISA. #cybersecurity #infosec

Added to KEV catalogue:

- CVE-2024-24919 Check Point Quantum Security Gateways Information Disclosure Vulnerability https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-24919

- CVE-2024-1086 #Linux Kernel Use-After-Free Vulnerability https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-1086

Advisories:

- Seven Industrial Control Systems Advisories https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2024/05/30/cisa-releases-seven-industrial-control-systems-advisories @cisacyber

##
jbhall56@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-30T12:30:33.000Z ##

Tracked as CVE-2024-24919, the zero-day allows hackers to obtain information on internet-connected network security gateways that have remote access VPN or mobile access enabled. https://www.securityweek.com/check-point-vpn-attacks-involve-zero-day-exploited-since-april/

##
decio@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-30T10:28:48.000Z ##

LOL l'état de ces appliances de sécurité en frontière 😅 (des pauvres petits Linux :linux: figés et « protégés » par obscurité) est telle que les fournisseurs arrivent à ce genre de gemmes en conseil de mitigation 🤦‍♂️
⬇️
Pour empêcher toute tentative d'exploitation de cette vulnérabilité, vous devez protéger la passerelle derrière une passerelle. 🆗 not 🆗

(source: https://labs.watchtowr.com/check-point-wrong-check-point-cve-2024-24919/

https://support.checkpoint.com/results/sk/sk182337?ref=labs.watchtowr.com )

##
campuscodi@mastodon.social at 2024-05-30T00:23:43.000Z ##

Check Point has released a security update to patch a zero-day exploited in its VPN and security appliances.

Tracked as CVE-2024-24919, the zero-day is an information disclosure that allows threat actor to retrieve data from appliances.

https://support.checkpoint.com/results/sk/sk182336

Security firm Mnemonic says it observed threat actors use the vulnerability to enumerate and extract password hashes, including the accounts used to connect to Active Directory.

https://www.mnemonic.io/resources/blog/advisory-check-point-remote-access-vpn-vulnerability-cve-2024-24919/

##
euroinfosec@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-29T10:53:55.000Z ##

Patch alert: Check Point issues "mandatory" security update for its security gateways to fix a vulnerability (CVE-2024-24919) being exploited in the wild, and which poses a risk when security gateways have Remote Access VPN or the Mobile Access blade enabled.
https://www.databreachtoday.com/check-point-issues-emergency-patch-for-security-gateways-a-25334

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-26T05:08:16.000Z ##

@patchnow24x7 What evidence do you have that CVE-2024-1086 is being exploited in the wild?

EDIT: 30 May 2024: CISA Adds Two Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog

  • CVE-2024-24919 (8.6 high) Check Point Quantum Security Gateways Information Disclosure Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-1086 (7.8 high) Linux Kernel Use-After-Free Vulnerability
##

CVE-2024-36470
(8.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2024-05-31T14:15:10.607000

4 posts

In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.7, 2022.10.6, 2023.05.6, 2023.11.5 authentication bypass was possible in specific edge cases

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat at 2024-05-29T19:25:35.427Z ##

HANG ONTO YOUR BUTTS! JetBrains has 18 vulnerabilities today. See parent toot for blog post:

  • CVE-2024-36470 (8.1 high) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 authentication bypass was possible in specific edge cases
  • CVE-2024-36378 (5.9 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 server was susceptible to DoS attacks with incorrect auth tokens
  • CVE-2024-36377 (6.5 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 certain TeamCity API endpoints did not check user permissions
  • CVE-2024-36376 (6.5 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 users could perform actions that should not be available to them based on their permissions
  • CVE-2024-36375 (5.3 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 technical information regarding TeamCity server could be exposed
  • CVE-2024-36374 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 stored XSS via build step settings was possible
  • CVE-2024-36373 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 several stored XSS in untrusted builds settings were possible
  • CVE-2024-36372 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2023.05.5 reflected XSS on the subscriptions page was possible
  • CVE-2024-36371 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 stored XSS in Commit status publisher was possible
  • CVE-2024-36370 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 stored XSS via OAuth connection settings was possible
  • CVE-2024-36369 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 stored XSS via issue tracker integration was possible
  • CVE-2024-36368 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 reflected XSS via OAuth provider configuration was possible
  • CVE-2024-36367 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 stored XSS via third-party reports was possible
  • CVE-2024-36366 (5.4 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 an XSS could be executed via certain report grouping and filtering operations
  • CVE-2024-36365 (6.8 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5, 2024.03.2 a third-party agent could impersonate a cloud agent
  • CVE-2024-36364 (6.5 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 improper access control in Pull Requests and Commit status publisher build features was possible
  • CVE-2024-36363 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 several Stored XSS in code inspection reports were possible
  • CVE-2024-36362 (6.5 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5, 2024.03.2 path traversal allowing to read files from server was possible

#JetBrains #TeamCity #vulnerability #PatchTuesday #CVE

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-29T13:41:20.034Z ##

JetBrains security advisory: TeamCity Major Bug-Fix Release for All Versions: Update Your Server Now
JetBrains, without revealing any details, discloses CVE-2024-36470. "We have since discovered that the security patch plugin doesn’t provide an optimal long-term way of protecting a TeamCity server from these vulnerabilities. In specific edge cases, it might still be possible to bypass the plugin."
EDIT: official NVD description for CVE-2024-36470 (CVSSv3: 8.1 high) was made available:

In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 authentication bypass was possible in specific edge cases

TeamCity 2024.03.2 Release Notes states that "8 security issues were fixed."

#CVE #JetBrains #vulnerability #teamcity #CVE_2024_36470

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-29T19:25:35.000Z ##

HANG ONTO YOUR BUTTS! JetBrains has 18 vulnerabilities today. See parent toot for blog post:

  • CVE-2024-36470 (8.1 high) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 authentication bypass was possible in specific edge cases
  • CVE-2024-36378 (5.9 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 server was susceptible to DoS attacks with incorrect auth tokens
  • CVE-2024-36377 (6.5 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 certain TeamCity API endpoints did not check user permissions
  • CVE-2024-36376 (6.5 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 users could perform actions that should not be available to them based on their permissions
  • CVE-2024-36375 (5.3 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 technical information regarding TeamCity server could be exposed
  • CVE-2024-36374 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 stored XSS via build step settings was possible
  • CVE-2024-36373 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 several stored XSS in untrusted builds settings were possible
  • CVE-2024-36372 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2023.05.5 reflected XSS on the subscriptions page was possible
  • CVE-2024-36371 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 stored XSS in Commit status publisher was possible
  • CVE-2024-36370 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 stored XSS via OAuth connection settings was possible
  • CVE-2024-36369 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 stored XSS via issue tracker integration was possible
  • CVE-2024-36368 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 reflected XSS via OAuth provider configuration was possible
  • CVE-2024-36367 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 stored XSS via third-party reports was possible
  • CVE-2024-36366 (5.4 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 an XSS could be executed via certain report grouping and filtering operations
  • CVE-2024-36365 (6.8 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5, 2024.03.2 a third-party agent could impersonate a cloud agent
  • CVE-2024-36364 (6.5 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 improper access control in Pull Requests and Commit status publisher build features was possible
  • CVE-2024-36363 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 several Stored XSS in code inspection reports were possible
  • CVE-2024-36362 (6.5 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5, 2024.03.2 path traversal allowing to read files from server was possible

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-29T13:41:20.000Z ##

JetBrains security advisory: TeamCity Major Bug-Fix Release for All Versions: Update Your Server Now
JetBrains, without revealing any details, discloses CVE-2024-36470. "We have since discovered that the security patch plugin doesn’t provide an optimal long-term way of protecting a TeamCity server from these vulnerabilities. In specific edge cases, it might still be possible to bypass the plugin."
EDIT: official NVD description for CVE-2024-36470 (CVSSv3: 8.1 high) was made available:

In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 authentication bypass was possible in specific edge cases

TeamCity 2024.03.2 Release Notes states that "8 security issues were fixed."

2 posts

1 repos

screaminggoat at 2024-05-29T19:25:35.427Z ##

HANG ONTO YOUR BUTTS! JetBrains has 18 vulnerabilities today. See parent toot for blog post:

  • CVE-2024-36470 (8.1 high) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 authentication bypass was possible in specific edge cases
  • CVE-2024-36378 (5.9 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 server was susceptible to DoS attacks with incorrect auth tokens
  • CVE-2024-36377 (6.5 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 certain TeamCity API endpoints did not check user permissions
  • CVE-2024-36376 (6.5 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 users could perform actions that should not be available to them based on their permissions
  • CVE-2024-36375 (5.3 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 technical information regarding TeamCity server could be exposed
  • CVE-2024-36374 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 stored XSS via build step settings was possible
  • CVE-2024-36373 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 several stored XSS in untrusted builds settings were possible
  • CVE-2024-36372 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2023.05.5 reflected XSS on the subscriptions page was possible
  • CVE-2024-36371 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 stored XSS in Commit status publisher was possible
  • CVE-2024-36370 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 stored XSS via OAuth connection settings was possible
  • CVE-2024-36369 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 stored XSS via issue tracker integration was possible
  • CVE-2024-36368 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 reflected XSS via OAuth provider configuration was possible
  • CVE-2024-36367 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 stored XSS via third-party reports was possible
  • CVE-2024-36366 (5.4 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 an XSS could be executed via certain report grouping and filtering operations
  • CVE-2024-36365 (6.8 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5, 2024.03.2 a third-party agent could impersonate a cloud agent
  • CVE-2024-36364 (6.5 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 improper access control in Pull Requests and Commit status publisher build features was possible
  • CVE-2024-36363 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 several Stored XSS in code inspection reports were possible
  • CVE-2024-36362 (6.5 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5, 2024.03.2 path traversal allowing to read files from server was possible

  • CVE-2024-36375 (5.3 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 technical information regarding TeamCity server could be exposed

  • CVE-2024-36373 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 several stored XSS in untrusted builds settings were possible

  • CVE-2024-36470 (8.1 high) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 authentication bypass was possible in specific edge cases
  • CVE-2024-36378 (5.9 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 server was susceptible to DoS attacks with incorrect auth tokens
  • CVE-2024-36377 (6.5 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 certain TeamCity API endpoints did not check user permissions
  • CVE-2024-36376 (6.5 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 users could perform actions that should not be available to them based on their permissions
  • CVE-2024-36375 (5.3 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 technical information regarding TeamCity server could be exposed
  • CVE-2024-36374 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 stored XSS via build step settings was possible
  • CVE-2024-36373 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 several stored XSS in untrusted builds settings were possible
  • CVE-2024-36372 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2023.05.5 reflected XSS on the subscriptions page was possible
  • CVE-2024-36371 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 stored XSS in Commit status publisher was possible
  • CVE-2024-36370 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 stored XSS via OAuth connection settings was possible
  • CVE-2024-36369 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 stored XSS via issue tracker integration was possible
  • CVE-2024-36368 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 reflected XSS via OAuth provider configuration was possible
  • CVE-2024-36367 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 stored XSS via third-party reports was possible
  • CVE-2024-36366 (5.4 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 an XSS could be executed via certain report grouping and filtering operations
  • CVE-2024-36365 (6.8 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5, 2024.03.2 a third-party agent could impersonate a cloud agent
  • CVE-2024-36364 (6.5 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 improper access control in Pull Requests and Commit status publisher build features was possible
  • CVE-2024-36363 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 several Stored XSS in code inspection reports were possible
  • CVE-2024-36362 (6.5 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5, 2024.03.2 path traversal allowing to read files from server was possible

#JetBrains #TeamCity #vulnerability #PatchTuesday #CVE

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-29T19:25:35.000Z ##

HANG ONTO YOUR BUTTS! JetBrains has 18 vulnerabilities today. See parent toot for blog post:

  • CVE-2024-36470 (8.1 high) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 authentication bypass was possible in specific edge cases
  • CVE-2024-36378 (5.9 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 server was susceptible to DoS attacks with incorrect auth tokens
  • CVE-2024-36377 (6.5 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 certain TeamCity API endpoints did not check user permissions
  • CVE-2024-36376 (6.5 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 users could perform actions that should not be available to them based on their permissions
  • CVE-2024-36375 (5.3 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 technical information regarding TeamCity server could be exposed
  • CVE-2024-36374 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 stored XSS via build step settings was possible
  • CVE-2024-36373 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 several stored XSS in untrusted builds settings were possible
  • CVE-2024-36372 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2023.05.5 reflected XSS on the subscriptions page was possible
  • CVE-2024-36371 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 stored XSS in Commit status publisher was possible
  • CVE-2024-36370 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 stored XSS via OAuth connection settings was possible
  • CVE-2024-36369 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 stored XSS via issue tracker integration was possible
  • CVE-2024-36368 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 reflected XSS via OAuth provider configuration was possible
  • CVE-2024-36367 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 stored XSS via third-party reports was possible
  • CVE-2024-36366 (5.4 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 an XSS could be executed via certain report grouping and filtering operations
  • CVE-2024-36365 (6.8 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5, 2024.03.2 a third-party agent could impersonate a cloud agent
  • CVE-2024-36364 (6.5 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 improper access control in Pull Requests and Commit status publisher build features was possible

  • CVE-2024-36362 (6.5 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5, 2024.03.2 path traversal allowing to read files from server was possible

screaminggoat at 2024-05-29T19:25:35.427Z ##

HANG ONTO YOUR BUTTS! JetBrains has 18 vulnerabilities today. See parent toot for blog post:

  • CVE-2024-36470 (8.1 high) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 authentication bypass was possible in specific edge cases
  • CVE-2024-36378 (5.9 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 server was susceptible to DoS attacks with incorrect auth tokens
  • CVE-2024-36377 (6.5 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 certain TeamCity API endpoints did not check user permissions
  • CVE-2024-36376 (6.5 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 users could perform actions that should not be available to them based on their permissions
  • CVE-2024-36375 (5.3 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 technical information regarding TeamCity server could be exposed
  • CVE-2024-36374 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 stored XSS via build step settings was possible
  • CVE-2024-36373 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 several stored XSS in untrusted builds settings were possible
  • CVE-2024-36372 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2023.05.5 reflected XSS on the subscriptions page was possible
  • CVE-2024-36371 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 stored XSS in Commit status publisher was possible
  • CVE-2024-36370 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 stored XSS via OAuth connection settings was possible
  • CVE-2024-36369 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 stored XSS via issue tracker integration was possible
  • CVE-2024-36368 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 reflected XSS via OAuth provider configuration was possible
  • CVE-2024-36367 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 stored XSS via third-party reports was possible
  • CVE-2024-36366 (5.4 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 an XSS could be executed via certain report grouping and filtering operations
  • CVE-2024-36365 (6.8 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5, 2024.03.2 a third-party agent could impersonate a cloud agent
  • CVE-2024-36364 (6.5 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 improper access control in Pull Requests and Commit status publisher build features was possible
  • CVE-2024-36363 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 several Stored XSS in code inspection reports were possible
  • CVE-2024-36362 (6.5 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5, 2024.03.2 path traversal allowing to read files from server was possible

#JetBrains #TeamCity #vulnerability #PatchTuesday #CVE

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-29T19:25:35.000Z ##

HANG ONTO YOUR BUTTS! JetBrains has 18 vulnerabilities today. See parent toot for blog post:

  • CVE-2024-36470 (8.1 high) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 authentication bypass was possible in specific edge cases
  • CVE-2024-36378 (5.9 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 server was susceptible to DoS attacks with incorrect auth tokens
  • CVE-2024-36377 (6.5 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 certain TeamCity API endpoints did not check user permissions
  • CVE-2024-36376 (6.5 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 users could perform actions that should not be available to them based on their permissions
  • CVE-2024-36375 (5.3 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 technical information regarding TeamCity server could be exposed
  • CVE-2024-36374 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 stored XSS via build step settings was possible
  • CVE-2024-36373 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 several stored XSS in untrusted builds settings were possible
  • CVE-2024-36372 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2023.05.5 reflected XSS on the subscriptions page was possible
  • CVE-2024-36371 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 stored XSS in Commit status publisher was possible
  • CVE-2024-36370 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 stored XSS via OAuth connection settings was possible
  • CVE-2024-36369 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 stored XSS via issue tracker integration was possible
  • CVE-2024-36368 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 reflected XSS via OAuth provider configuration was possible
  • CVE-2024-36367 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 stored XSS via third-party reports was possible
  • CVE-2024-36366 (5.4 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 an XSS could be executed via certain report grouping and filtering operations
  • CVE-2024-36365 (6.8 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5, 2024.03.2 a third-party agent could impersonate a cloud agent

  • CVE-2024-36362 (6.5 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5, 2024.03.2 path traversal allowing to read files from server was possible

screaminggoat at 2024-05-29T19:25:35.427Z ##

HANG ONTO YOUR BUTTS! JetBrains has 18 vulnerabilities today. See parent toot for blog post:

  • CVE-2024-36470 (8.1 high) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 authentication bypass was possible in specific edge cases
  • CVE-2024-36378 (5.9 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 server was susceptible to DoS attacks with incorrect auth tokens
  • CVE-2024-36377 (6.5 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 certain TeamCity API endpoints did not check user permissions
  • CVE-2024-36376 (6.5 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 users could perform actions that should not be available to them based on their permissions
  • CVE-2024-36375 (5.3 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 technical information regarding TeamCity server could be exposed
  • CVE-2024-36374 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 stored XSS via build step settings was possible
  • CVE-2024-36373 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 several stored XSS in untrusted builds settings were possible
  • CVE-2024-36372 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2023.05.5 reflected XSS on the subscriptions page was possible
  • CVE-2024-36371 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 stored XSS in Commit status publisher was possible
  • CVE-2024-36370 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 stored XSS via OAuth connection settings was possible
  • CVE-2024-36369 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 stored XSS via issue tracker integration was possible
  • CVE-2024-36368 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 reflected XSS via OAuth provider configuration was possible
  • CVE-2024-36367 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 stored XSS via third-party reports was possible
  • CVE-2024-36366 (5.4 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 an XSS could be executed via certain report grouping and filtering operations
  • CVE-2024-36365 (6.8 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5, 2024.03.2 a third-party agent could impersonate a cloud agent
  • CVE-2024-36364 (6.5 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 improper access control in Pull Requests and Commit status publisher build features was possible
  • CVE-2024-36363 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 several Stored XSS in code inspection reports were possible
  • CVE-2024-36362 (6.5 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5, 2024.03.2 path traversal allowing to read files from server was possible

HANG ONTO YOUR BUTTS! JetBrains has 18 vulnerabilities today. See parent toot for blog post:

  • CVE-2024-36470 (8.1 high) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 authentication bypass was possible in specific edge cases
  • CVE-2024-36378 (5.9 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 server was susceptible to DoS attacks with incorrect auth tokens
  • CVE-2024-36377 (6.5 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 certain TeamCity API endpoints did not check user permissions
  • CVE-2024-36376 (6.5 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 users could perform actions that should not be available to them based on their permissions
  • CVE-2024-36375 (5.3 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 technical information regarding TeamCity server could be exposed
  • CVE-2024-36374 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 stored XSS via build step settings was possible
  • CVE-2024-36373 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 several stored XSS in untrusted builds settings were possible
  • CVE-2024-36372 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2023.05.5 reflected XSS on the subscriptions page was possible
  • CVE-2024-36371 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 stored XSS in Commit status publisher was possible
  • CVE-2024-36370 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 stored XSS via OAuth connection settings was possible
  • CVE-2024-36369 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 stored XSS via issue tracker integration was possible
  • CVE-2024-36368 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 reflected XSS via OAuth provider configuration was possible
  • CVE-2024-36367 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 stored XSS via third-party reports was possible
  • CVE-2024-36366 (5.4 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 an XSS could be executed via certain report grouping and filtering operations
  • CVE-2024-36365 (6.8 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5, 2024.03.2 a third-party agent could impersonate a cloud agent

  • CVE-2024-36363 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 several Stored XSS in code inspection reports were possible
  • CVE-2024-36362 (6.5 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5, 2024.03.2 path traversal allowing to read files from server was possible

  • CVE-2024-36470 (8.1 high) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 authentication bypass was possible in specific edge cases
  • CVE-2024-36378 (5.9 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 server was susceptible to DoS attacks with incorrect auth tokens
  • CVE-2024-36377 (6.5 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 certain TeamCity API endpoints did not check user permissions
  • CVE-2024-36376 (6.5 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 users could perform actions that should not be available to them based on their permissions
  • CVE-2024-36375 (5.3 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 technical information regarding TeamCity server could be exposed
  • CVE-2024-36374 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 stored XSS via build step settings was possible
  • CVE-2024-36373 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03.2 several stored XSS in untrusted builds settings were possible
  • CVE-2024-36372 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2023.05.5 reflected XSS on the subscriptions page was possible
  • CVE-2024-36371 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 stored XSS in Commit status publisher was possible
  • CVE-2024-36370 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 stored XSS via OAuth connection settings was possible
  • CVE-2024-36369 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 stored XSS via issue tracker integration was possible
  • CVE-2024-36368 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 reflected XSS via OAuth provider configuration was possible
  • CVE-2024-36367 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 stored XSS via third-party reports was possible
  • CVE-2024-36366 (5.4 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 an XSS could be executed via certain report grouping and filtering operations
  • CVE-2024-36365 (6.8 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5, 2024.03.2 a third-party agent could impersonate a cloud agent
  • CVE-2024-36364 (6.5 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 improper access control in Pull Requests and Commit status publisher build features was possible
  • CVE-2024-36363 (4.6 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5 several Stored XSS in code inspection reports were possible
  • CVE-2024-36362 (6.5 medium) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2022.04.6, 2022.10.5, 2023.05.5, 2023.11.5, 2024.03.2 path traversal allowing to read files from server was possible

(5.5 MEDIUM)

updated 2024-05-31T11:15:09.563000

Zoho ManageEngine ADAudit Plus versions 7260 and below allows unauthorized local agent machine users to view the session recordings.

campuscodi@mastodon.social at 2024-05-28T14:15:29.000Z ##

Security firm Shelltrail has published a three-part write-up on two vulnerabilities (CVE-2024-36036 & CVE-2024-36037) in ManageEngine ADAudit Plus, a product used for real-time monitoring of Active Directory, Windows file servers, and Windows configuration change auditing.

https://www.shelltrail.com/research/manageengine-adaudit-reverse-engineering-windows-rpc-to-find-cve-2024-36036-and-cve-2024-36037-part1/

https://www.shelltrail.com/research/manageengine-adaudit-reverse-engineering-windows-rpc-to-find-cve-2024-36036-and-cve-2024-36037-part2/

https://www.shelltrail.com/research/manageengine-adaudit-reverse-engineering-windows-rpc-to-find-cve-2024-36036-and-cve-2024-36037-part3/

##

CVE-2024-1086
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2024-05-31T01:00:03.283000

24 posts

A use-after-free vulnerability in the Linux kernel's netfilter: nf_tables component can be exploited to achieve local privilege escalation. The nft_verdict_init() function allows positive values as drop error within the hook verdict, and hence the nf_hook_slow() function can cause a double free vulnerability when NF_DROP is issued with a drop error which resembles NF_ACCEPT. We recommend upgradi

5 repos

https://github.com/Notselwyn/CVE-2024-1086

https://github.com/rootkalilocalhost/CVE-2024-1086

https://github.com/CCIEVoice2009/CVE-2024-1086

https://github.com/Alicey0719/docker-POC_CVE-2024-1086

https://github.com/kevcooper/CVE-2024-1086-checker

TomiMcCluskey at 2024-06-03T20:20:23.596Z ##

CISA confirms CVE-2024-1086 active attacks in the wild on Linux kernel versions 5.14-6.6.14 using netfilter vuln for privilege escalation. Major distros like Debian, Fedora, RHEL, Ubuntu affected. Check if you're patched with "uname -r".

Mitigation steps in article. Stay safe!

https://opensourcewatch.beehiiv.com/p/nasty-linux-bug-cve20241086-loose

@screaminggoat

#infosec #CISA #linuxsecurity #vulnerability #CVE_2024_1086

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-30T15:56:23.104Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds Two Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog

  • CVE-2024-24919 (8.6 high) Check Point Quantum Security Gateways Information Disclosure Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-1086 (7.8 high) Linux Kernel Use-After-Free Vulnerability

#CVE_2024_1086 #CVE_2024_24919 #CVE #kev #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA #activeexploitation #eitw #CheckPoint #VPN #Linux

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-25T15:07:36.662Z ##

Currently top trending vulnerability on Twitter according to CVE Trends:
CVE-2024-1086 (7.8 high, disclosed 30 January 2024 by Google, Proof of Concept and vulnerability details available) Linux Kernel Privilege Escalation Vulnerability, working on most Linux kernels between v5.14 and v6.6, including Debian, Ubuntu, and KernelCTF.

Due to a use-after-free vulnerability in the netfilter: nf_tables component of the Linux kernel, the nft_verdict_init() function allows the use of positive values as a drop error in the hook verdict. When NF_DROP issues a drop error similar to NF_ACCEPT, the nf_hook_slow() function could lead to a double-free vulnerability. Local attackers could exploit this flaw to elevate privileges from a regular user to root.

There's an amusing shitpost "No way to prevent this" say users of only language where this regularly happens courtesy of @cadey

#CVE_2024_1086 #Linux #CVE #vulnerability

##
TomiMcCluskey@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-03T20:20:23.000Z ##

CISA confirms CVE-2024-1086 active attacks in the wild on Linux kernel versions 5.14-6.6.14 using netfilter vuln for privilege escalation. Major distros like Debian, Fedora, RHEL, Ubuntu affected. Check if you're patched with "uname -r".

Mitigation steps in article. Stay safe!

https://opensourcewatch.beehiiv.com/p/nasty-linux-bug-cve20241086-loose

@screaminggoat

#infosec #CISA #linuxsecurity #vulnerability #CVE_2024_1086

  • CVE-2024-1086 (7.8 high) Linux Kernel Use-After-Free Vulnerability
