screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-23T14:10:28.000Z ##

Unit 42: Operation Diplomatic Specter: An Active Chinese Cyberespionage Campaign Leverages Rare Tool Set to Target Governmental Entities in the Middle East, Africa and Asia
Unit 42 reports on a Chinese APT (TGR-STA-0043) conducting an ongoing campaign (called Operation Diplomatic Specter) targeting political entities in the Middle East, Africa and Asia since at least late 2022. An analysis of this threat actor’s activity reveals long-term espionage operations against at least seven governmental entities. The threat actor performed intelligence collection efforts at a large scale, leveraging rare email exfiltration techniques against compromised servers. Their collection efforts are on geopolitical affairs: diplomatic/economic missions, embassies, military operations, political meetings, ministries, and high ranking officials. This includes two new backdoors, called TunnelSpecter and SweetSpecter. Microsoft Exchange vulnerabilities CVE-2021-26855 (ProxyLogon) and CVE-2021-34473 (ProxyShell) are used for initial access. There’s a lot of information about motivation, victimology, malware analyses, attribution, overlaps with other Chinese threat actors, etc. IOC provided.

#threatintel #cyberespionage #TGRSTA0043 #China #IOC #OperationDiplomaticSpecter #CVE_2021_26855 #CVE_2021_34473 #ProxyLogon #ProxyShell

Aqua: Muhstik Malware Targets Message Queuing Services Applications
Aqua Nautilus discovered a new campaign of Muhstik malware targeting message queuing services applications such as Apache RocketMQ. The attackers downloaded Muhstik onto the compromised instances by exploiting CVE-2023-33246 (9.8 critical, disclosed 23 May 2023 by Apache, added to KEV Catalog 06 September 2023. Apache RocketMQ Command Execution Vulnerability). Aqua describes the vulnerability exploitation, attacker actions on objective, and provide IOC.

TP-Link Archer AX21 (AX1800) firmware versions before 1.1.4 Build 20230219 contained a command injection vulnerability in the country form of the /cgi-bin/luci;stok=/locale endpoint on the web management interface. Specifically, the country parameter of the write operation was not sanitized before being used in a call to popen(), allowing an unauthenticated attacker to inject commands, which would

2 repos

https://github.com/Terminal1337/CVE-2023-1389

screaminggoat at 2024-05-30T19:37:11.382Z ##

Akamai: RedTail Cryptominer Threat Actors Adopt PAN-OS CVE-2024-3400 Exploit
The threat actors behind the RedTail cryptomining malware have Palo Alto PAN-OS CVE-2024-3400 vulnerability into their toolkit. The new variant of RedTail now includes antiresearch techniques that were not previously observed. They employ private cryptomining pools for greater control over mining outcomes, mirroring tactics used by the Lazarus group and leading to speculation about attack attribution. The malware spreads by using at least six different web exploits, targeting Internet of Things (IoT) devices (such as TP-Link routers), web applications (including the China-origin content management system ThinkPHP), SSL-VPNs, and security devices like Ivanti Connect Secure and Palo Alto GlobalProtect. The specific malware servers that served this variant were active from early April 2024 through the beginning of May 2024, with PAN-OS exploitation noted since at least 21 April. IOC were provided.

CVE-2024-3400 (10.0 critical, disclosed 12 April 2024 by Palo Alto Networks as an exploited zero-day, added to CISA's KEV Catalog same day) is an OS Command Injection Vulnerability in GlobalProtect Gateway (firewall).

Other exploited vulnerablities:

  • CVE-2023-46805
  • CVE-2024-21887
  • CVE-2023-1389
  • CVE-2022-22954
  • CVE-2018-20062
  • CVE-2017-9841

#retail #cryptominer #threatintel #IOC #CVE_2024_3400 #CVE_2023_46805 #CVE_2024_21887 #CVE_2023_1389 #CVE_2022_22954 #CVE_2018_20062 #CVE_2017_9841

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-30T19:37:11.000Z ##

Akamai: RedTail Cryptominer Threat Actors Adopt PAN-OS CVE-2024-3400 Exploit
The threat actors behind the RedTail cryptomining malware have Palo Alto PAN-OS CVE-2024-3400 vulnerability into their toolkit. The new variant of RedTail now includes antiresearch techniques that were not previously observed. They employ private cryptomining pools for greater control over mining outcomes, mirroring tactics used by the Lazarus group and leading to speculation about attack attribution. The malware spreads by using at least six different web exploits, targeting Internet of Things (IoT) devices (such as TP-Link routers), web applications (including the China-origin content management system ThinkPHP), SSL-VPNs, and security devices like Ivanti Connect Secure and Palo Alto GlobalProtect. The specific malware servers that served this variant were active from early April 2024 through the beginning of May 2024, with PAN-OS exploitation noted since at least 21 April. IOC were provided.

CVE-2024-3400 (10.0 critical, disclosed 12 April 2024 by Palo Alto Networks as an exploited zero-day, added to CISA's KEV Catalog same day) is an OS Command Injection Vulnerability in GlobalProtect Gateway (firewall).

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-30T13:30:30.566Z ##

Trend Micro: Decoding Water Sigbin's Latest Obfuscation Tricks
Trend Micro writes about the 8220 gang, a Chinese financially motivated threat actor group known for deploying cryptominers in cloud-based environments and Linux servers. They write about the exploitation of Oracle WebLogic vulnerabilities CVE-2017-3506 (7.4 high) and CVE-2023-21839 (7.5 high) to deploy a cryptocurrency miner via a PowerShell script. They provide an analysis of the bat file. IOC and MITRE ATT&CK TTPs provided.

Sysdig: DDoS-as-a-Service: The Rebirth Botnet
Sysdig reports a DDoS-as-a-Service Mirai-based botnet using the domain rebirthltd[.]com to launch attacks. IOC not really included.

##

CVE-2017-5705
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2023-02-02T05:07:30

1 posts

Multiple buffer overflows in kernel in Intel Manageability Engine Firmware 11.0/11.5/11.6/11.7/11.10/11.20 allow attacker with local access to the system to execute arbitrary code.

mkukri@mas.to at 2024-05-26T12:48:36.000Z ##

@Evv1L @libreleah

This uses CVE-2017-5705.

It has been fixed by Intel in newer ME v11.x.x.x firmware releases, however ME11 hardware has no protection again downgrading the ME version by overwriting the SPI flash physically, thus we can downgrade to a vulnerable version.

After downgrade, we exploit the bup module of the vulnerable firmware, overwriting the copy of boot guard FPFs stored in SRAM, resulting in the fused boot guard configuration being replaced with our desired one.

screaminggoat at 2024-05-31T14:31:33.304Z ##

One of the IP addresses in the IOC provided by Check Point (see parent toot above) 156.146.56.136 was previously reported by Volexity in Zero-Day Exploitation of Atlassian Confluence (02 June 2022). CVE-2022-26134 (9.8 critical, disclosed 02 June 2022 by Atlassian as an exploited zero-day) Confluence Data Center and Server RCE was exploited by likely Chinese actors:

Volexity has reason to believe this exploit is currently in use by multiple threat actors and that the likely country of origin of these attackers is China.

There is a very likely link to Chinese threat actors based on the zero-day exploitation of a VPN. Following Cisco's reporting of ArcaneDoor campaign by state-sponsored actors (likely China) on 24 April 2024. cc: @campuscodi @hrbrmstr @zeljkazorz

#CVE_2024_24919 #activeexploitation #eitw #CheckPoint #VPN #IOC #threatintel #China #cyberespionage

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-31T14:31:33.000Z ##

One of the IP addresses in the IOC provided by Check Point (see parent toot above) 156.146.56.136 was previously reported by Volexity in Zero-Day Exploitation of Atlassian Confluence (02 June 2022). CVE-2022-26134 (9.8 critical, disclosed 02 June 2022 by Atlassian as an exploited zero-day) Confluence Data Center and Server RCE was exploited by likely Chinese actors:

Volexity has reason to believe this exploit is currently in use by multiple threat actors and that the likely country of origin of these attackers is China.

There is a very likely link to Chinese threat actors based on the zero-day exploitation of a VPN. Following Cisco's reporting of ArcaneDoor campaign by state-sponsored actors (likely China) on 24 April 2024. cc: @campuscodi @hrbrmstr @zeljkazorz

#CVE_2024_24919 #activeexploitation #eitw #CheckPoint #VPN #IOC #threatintel #China #cyberespionage

##

CVE-2022-22954
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 97.41%

updated 2022-09-09T16:47:37.017000

4 posts

VMware Workspace ONE Access and Identity Manager contain a remote code execution vulnerability due to server-side template injection. A malicious actor with network access can trigger a server-side template injection that may result in remote code execution.

Nuclei template

31 repos

screaminggoat at 2024-05-30T19:37:11.382Z ##

Akamai: RedTail Cryptominer Threat Actors Adopt PAN-OS CVE-2024-3400 Exploit
The threat actors behind the RedTail cryptomining malware have Palo Alto PAN-OS CVE-2024-3400 vulnerability into their toolkit. The new variant of RedTail now includes antiresearch techniques that were not previously observed. They employ private cryptomining pools for greater control over mining outcomes, mirroring tactics used by the Lazarus group and leading to speculation about attack attribution. The malware spreads by using at least six different web exploits, targeting Internet of Things (IoT) devices (such as TP-Link routers), web applications (including the China-origin content management system ThinkPHP), SSL-VPNs, and security devices like Ivanti Connect Secure and Palo Alto GlobalProtect. The specific malware servers that served this variant were active from early April 2024 through the beginning of May 2024, with PAN-OS exploitation noted since at least 21 April. IOC were provided.

CVE-2024-3400 (10.0 critical, disclosed 12 April 2024 by Palo Alto Networks as an exploited zero-day, added to CISA's KEV Catalog same day) is an OS Command Injection Vulnerability in GlobalProtect Gateway (firewall).

Other exploited vulnerablities:

  • CVE-2023-46805
  • CVE-2024-21887
  • CVE-2023-1389
  • CVE-2022-22954
  • CVE-2018-20062
  • CVE-2017-9841

#retail #cryptominer #threatintel #IOC #CVE_2024_3400 #CVE_2023_46805 #CVE_2024_21887 #CVE_2023_1389 #CVE_2022_22954 #CVE_2018_20062 #CVE_2017_9841

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-30T19:37:11.000Z ##

The threat actors behind the RedTail cryptomining malware have Palo Alto PAN-OS CVE-2024-3400 vulnerability into their toolkit. The new variant of RedTail now includes antiresearch techniques that were not previously observed. They employ private cryptomining pools for greater control over mining outcomes, mirroring tactics used by the Lazarus group and leading to speculation about attack attribution. The malware spreads by using at least six different web exploits, targeting Internet of Things (IoT) devices (such as TP-Link routers), web applications (including the China-origin content management system ThinkPHP), SSL-VPNs, and security devices like Ivanti Connect Secure and Palo Alto GlobalProtect. ##

CVE-2019-9082
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 97.45%

updated 2022-04-05T20:42:47.120000

4 posts

ThinkPHP before 3.2.4, as used in Open Source BMS v1.1.1 and other products, allows Remote Command Execution via public//?s=index/\think\app/invokefunction&function=call_user_func_array&vars[0]=system&vars[1][]= followed by the command.

screaminggoat at 2024-06-05T14:51:38.338Z ##

Akamai: 2024: Old CVEs, New Targets — Active Exploitation of ThinkPHP
Akamai reports a cyberespionage campaign that targets ThinkPHP applications that are vulnerable to CVE-2018-20062 and CVE-2019-9082, by likely Chinese-speaking threat actors. The campaign seems to have started in as early as October 2023 by targeting a limited number of customers/organizations. It only recently became widespread. The attacks originated from various IP addresses associated with servers hosted on the "Zenlayer" cloud provider (ASN 21859), primarily located in Hong Kong. The exploit attempts to retrieve additional obfuscated code from another compromised ThinkPHP server to gain initial foothold. After successfully exploiting the system, the attackers will install a Chinese language web shell named Dama to maintain persistent access to the server. Subsequent actions may involve spreading further within the victim's data center or enlisting the server for use in attack infrastructure. No IOC.

#China #cyberespionage #threatintel #CVE_2018_20062 #CVE_2019_9082

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-05T14:51:38.000Z ##

##

CVE-2019-15901
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.25%

updated 2020-08-24T17:37:01.140000

2 posts

An issue was discovered in slicer69 doas before 6.2 on certain platforms other than OpenBSD. A setusercontext(3) call with flags to change the UID, primary GID, and secondary GIDs was replaced (on certain platforms: Linux and possibly NetBSD) with a single setuid(2) call. This resulted in neither changing the group id nor initializing secondary group ids.

brokenix@emacs.ch at 2024-05-29T22:46:49.000Z ##

#doas : multiple security issues
Buffer overflow (privilege escalation to root)
Broken UID parsing falls back to root (CVE-2019-15900)
Incorrect group change behaviour (CVE-2019-15901)
https://github.com/slicer69/doas/pull/23

##
brokenix@emacs.ch at 2024-05-29T22:46:49.000Z ##

#doas : multiple security issues
Buffer overflow (privilege escalation to root)
Broken UID parsing falls back to root (CVE-2019-15900)
Incorrect group change behaviour (CVE-2019-15901)
https://github.com/slicer69/doas/pull/23

##

CVE-2018-20062
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 96.68%

updated 2020-04-14T18:15:11.970000

8 posts

An issue was discovered in NoneCms V1.3. thinkphp/library/think/App.php allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary PHP code via crafted use of the filter parameter, as demonstrated by the s=index/\think\Request/input&filter=phpinfo&data=1 query string.

2 repos

https://github.com/NS-Sp4ce/thinkphp5.XRce

https://github.com/yilin1203/CVE-2018-20062

screaminggoat at 2024-06-05T14:51:38.338Z ##

Akamai reports a cyberespionage campaign that targets ThinkPHP applications that are vulnerable to CVE-2018-20062 and CVE-2019-9082, by likely Chinese-speaking threat actors. ##

CVE-2024-29404
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.00%

4 posts

N/A

screaminggoat at 2024-06-05T16:10:15.335Z ##

Cisco security advisory: Cisco Finesse Web-Based Management Interface Vulnerabilities

  • CVE-2024-20404 (7.2 high) Cisco Finesse SSRF Vulnerability: A vulnerability in the web-based management interface of Cisco Finesse could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to conduct an SSRF attack on an affected system.
  • CVE-2024-20405 (7.2 high) Cisco Finesse Stored XSS through RFI Vulnerability: A vulnerability in the web-based management interface of Cisco Finesse could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to conduct a stored XSS attack by exploiting an RFI vulnerability.

The Cisco PSIRT is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerabilities that are described in this advisory.

#Cisco #PatchTuesday #CVE #vulnerability #CVE_2024_29404 #CVE_2024_29405

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-05T16:10:15.000Z ##

Cisco security advisory: Cisco Finesse Web-Based Management Interface Vulnerabilities

  • CVE-2024-20404 (7.2 high) Cisco Finesse SSRF Vulnerability: A vulnerability in the web-based management interface of Cisco Finesse could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to conduct an SSRF attack on an affected system.
  • CVE-2024-20405 (7.2 high) Cisco Finesse Stored XSS through RFI Vulnerability: A vulnerability in the web-based management interface of Cisco Finesse could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to conduct a stored XSS attack by exploiting an RFI vulnerability.

The Cisco PSIRT is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerabilities that are described in this advisory.

#Cisco #PatchTuesday #CVE #vulnerability #CVE_2024_29404 #CVE_2024_29405

##
screaminggoat at 2024-06-05T16:10:15.335Z ##

Cisco security advisory: Cisco Finesse Web-Based Management Interface Vulnerabilities

  • CVE-2024-20404 (7.2 high) Cisco Finesse SSRF Vulnerability: A vulnerability in the web-based management interface of Cisco Finesse could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to conduct an SSRF attack on an affected system.
  • CVE-2024-20405 (7.2 high) Cisco Finesse Stored XSS through RFI Vulnerability: A vulnerability in the web-based management interface of Cisco Finesse could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to conduct a stored XSS attack by exploiting an RFI vulnerability.

The Cisco PSIRT is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerabilities that are described in this advisory.

#Cisco #PatchTuesday #CVE #vulnerability #CVE_2024_29404 #CVE_2024_29405

CVE-2024-36121
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.00%

2 posts

N/A

SalusaSecondus@wandering.shop at 2024-06-04T22:19:58.000Z ##

To all those security people out there thinking that you can't be a "real" security engineer without a #CVE (and preferably lots of them). I want to share the *first* CVE that I actually have in almost 20 years of work!

Why so long? Almost nothing I fixed was publicly visible or semi-coordinated embargoes made a CVE impractical.

Don't let people gatekeep you with stupid stuff.

CVE-2024-36121

(No, it isn't practically exploitable. Nothing to worry about.)
https://github.com/netty/netty-incubator-codec-ohttp/security/advisories/GHSA-g762-h86w-8749

##
SalusaSecondus@wandering.shop at 2024-06-04T22:19:58.000Z ##

To all those security people out there thinking that you can't be a "real" security engineer without a #CVE (and preferably lots of them). I want to share the *first* CVE that I actually have in almost 20 years of work!

CVE-2024-36121

##

CVE-2024-34161
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.00%

2 posts

N/A

screaminggoat at 2024-06-01T18:45:17.124Z ##

@neustradamus For context, nginx is a popular open source web server (HTTP and reverse proxy server, mail proxy server, and generic TCP/UDP proxy server). Shodan search shows 34,582,612 worldwide, with the U.S. and China almost tied in the high 7 million each. The following vulnerabilities were fixed 29 May 2024:

  • CVE-2024-32760 (6.5 med) OOB write to DoS (or worse)
  • CVE-2024-31079 (4.8 med) stack buffer overflow to DoS
  • CVE-2024-35200 (5.3 med) Null pointer dereference to DoS
  • CVE-2024-34161 (5.3 med) UAF info disclosure

I think it's funny that F5 disclosed their own security advisories of these vulns as "final" because they don't affect any of their products.

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-06-01T18:45:17.000Z ##

@neustradamus For context, nginx is a popular open source web server (HTTP and reverse proxy server, mail proxy server, and generic TCP/UDP proxy server). Shodan search shows 34,582,612 worldwide, with the U.S. and China almost tied in the high 7 million each. The following vulnerabilities were fixed 29 May 2024:

  • CVE-2024-32760 (6.5 med) OOB write to DoS (or worse)
  • CVE-2024-31079 (4.8 med) stack buffer overflow to DoS
  • CVE-2024-35200 (5.3 med) Null pointer dereference to DoS
  • CVE-2024-34161 (5.3 med) UAF info disclosure

I think it's funny that F5 disclosed their own security advisories of these vulns as "final" because they don't affect any of their products.

##
AAKL at 2024-05-28T15:33:17.743Z ##

#CISA entries today:

- CVE-2024-5274 KEV catalogue entry: #Google Chromium V8 Type Confusion Vulnerability https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-5274

- One Industrial Control Systems Advisory: Campbell Scientific CSI Web Server https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2024/05/28/cisa-releases-one-industrial-control-systems-advisory @cisacyber #cybersecurity #infosec

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-28T15:08:39.792Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds One Known Exploited Vulnerability to Catalog
Hot off the press! CISA adds the Google Chrome zero-day CVE-2024-5274 (see parent toot above for information) to the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) Catalog.

#CVE_2024_5274 #zeroday #vulnerability #CVE #KEV #eitw #activeexploitation #Chrome

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-25T17:38:59.578Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) Chromium security advisories:

  • CVE-2024-5157 (high) Chromium: Use after free in Scheduling.
  • CVE-2024-5158 (high) Chromium: Type Confusion in V8
  • CVE-2024-5159 (high) Chromium: Heap buffer overflow in ANGLE.
  • CVE-2024-5160 (high) Chromium: Heap buffer overflow in Dawn.
  • CVE-2024-5274 (high) Chromium: Type Confusion in V8

Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) ingests Chromium, which addresses these vulnerabilities. Google is aware that an exploit for CVE-2024-5274 exists in the wild.

Note: These vulnerabilities were disclosed on Tuesday 21 May 2024 (see parent toot above) and the zero-day on Thursday 23 May 2024.

#CVE_2024_5157 #CVE_2024_5158 #CVE_2024_5159 #CVE_2024_5160 #CVE_2024_5274 #vulnerability #CVE #MSRC #Microsoft #Chrome

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-25T04:45:58.614Z ##

@browserversiontracker For reference: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/deployedge/microsoft-edge-relnotes-security

Microsoft has a fix for CVE-2024-5274 to Microsoft Edge Stable Channel (Version 125.0.2535.67), which has been reported by the Chromium team as having an exploit in the wild. For more information, see the Security Update Guide

The issue is that Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) didn’t create (or make live) the CVE-2024-5274 page at the time of publishing this message on 24 May 2024. cc: @ruario

##
beardedtechguy@allthingstech.social at 2024-05-24T16:54:08.000Z ##

This update includes a security fix from Chromium upstream to resolve “CVE-2024-5274: Type Confusion in V8”, an exploit for which exists in the wild.

Minor update (7) for Vivaldi Desktop Browser 6.7 https://vivaldi.com/blog/desktop/minor-update-seven-6-7/

#Vivaldi #Browser

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-24T15:23:28.780Z ##

@browserversiontracker For reference: https://blogs.opera.com/desktop/2024/05/opera-110-0-5130-39-stable-update/

Note: Opera referred to CVE-2024-5274 as a 0-day

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-24T14:40:09.913Z ##

@avoidthehack Vivaldi Desktop Browser, a Chromium-based web browser, version 6.7 "includes a security fix from Chromium upstream to resolve “CVE-2024-5274: Type Confusion in V8”, an exploit for which exists in the wild." https://vivaldi.com/blog/desktop/minor-update-seven-6-7/
cc: @ruario

##
avoidthehack at 2024-05-24T14:26:13.646Z ##

#Google fixes eighth actively exploited #Chrome zero-day this year

Another day, another 0 day in Chrome. It is another type confusion vulnerability in V8 (Chromium’s JavaScript engine). Evidence of active exploitation in the wild.

Tracked as CVE-2024-5274.

Affects #Chromium based web #browsers (not just Chrome), so maintained forks should be rolling updates ASAP.

#cve #cybersecurity #security #infosec

https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/google-fixes-eighth-actively-exploited-chrome-zero-day-this-year/

##
jbhall56 at 2024-05-24T13:16:13.857Z ##

Assigned the CVE identifier CVE-2024-5274, the vulnerability relates to a type confusion bug in the V8 JavaScript and WebAssembly engine. It was reported by Clément Lecigne of Google's Threat Analysis Group and Brendon Tiszka of Chrome Security on May 20, 2024. https://thehackernews.com/2024/05/google-detects-4th-chrome-zero-day-in.html

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-24T11:16:12.127Z ##

Google Chrome zero-day: Stable Channel Update for Desktop
CVE-2024-5274 (high severity) Type Confusion in V8. Reported by Clément Lecigne of Google's Threat Analysis Group and Brendon Tiszka of Chrome Security on 2024-05-20

Google is aware that an exploit for CVE-2024-5274 exists in the wild.

#zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #vulnerability #cve #CVE_2024_5274 #chrome #google

##
jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-05-24T08:20:05.000Z ##

Google fixes yet another Chrome zero-day exploited in the wild (CVE-2024-5274) https://www.helpnetsecurity.com/2024/05/24/cve-2024-5274/ #securityupdate #vulnerability #Don'tmiss #Hotstuff #Vivaldi #Chrome #0-day #News #CVE

##
ruario@vivaldi.net at 2024-05-24T05:01:42.000Z ##

> I might expand on what that means later

So to expand. Yes it has a fix for “CVE-2024-5274: Type Confusion in V8” but I wanted to give Google a chance to release first. They did the work to fix this.

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-24T14:40:09.000Z ##

@avoidthehack Vivaldi Desktop Browser, a Chromium-based web browser, version 6.7 "includes a security fix from Chromium upstream to resolve “CVE-2024-5274: Type Confusion in V8”, an exploit for which exists in the wild." https://vivaldi.com/blog/desktop/minor-update-seven-6-7/
cc: @ruario

##
avoidthehack@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-24T14:26:13.000Z ##

#Google fixes eighth actively exploited #Chrome zero-day this year

Another day, another 0 day in Chrome. It is another type confusion vulnerability in V8 (Chromium’s JavaScript engine). Evidence of active exploitation in the wild.

Tracked as CVE-2024-5274.

Affects #Chromium based web #browsers (not just Chrome), so maintained forks should be rolling updates ASAP.

#cve #cybersecurity #security #infosec

https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/google-fixes-eighth-actively-exploited-chrome-zero-day-this-year/

##
jbhall56@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-24T13:16:13.000Z ##

Assigned the CVE identifier CVE-2024-5274, the vulnerability relates to a type confusion bug in the V8 JavaScript and WebAssembly engine. It was reported by Clément Lecigne of Google's Threat Analysis Group and Brendon Tiszka of Chrome Security on May 20, 2024. https://thehackernews.com/2024/05/google-detects-4th-chrome-zero-day-in.html

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-24T11:16:12.000Z ##

Google Chrome zero-day: Stable Channel Update for Desktop
CVE-2024-5274 (high severity) Type Confusion in V8. Reported by Clément Lecigne of Google's Threat Analysis Group and Brendon Tiszka of Chrome Security on 2024-05-20

Google is aware that an exploit for CVE-2024-5274 exists in the wild.

#zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #vulnerability #cve #CVE_2024_5274 #chrome #google

##
ruario@vivaldi.net at 2024-05-24T05:01:42.000Z ##

> I might expand on what that means later

So to expand. Yes it has a fix for “CVE-2024-5274: Type Confusion in V8” but I wanted to give Google a chance to release first. They did the work to fix this.

##
screaminggoat at 2024-05-28T13:41:33.509Z ##

Citrix security advisory: Citrix Workspace app for Mac Security Bulletin for CVE-2024-5027
CVE-2024-5027 (7.7 high) Elevation of privilege from a local authenticated user to a root user (IF they have local authenticated user access to the device where Citrix Workspace App for Mac is installed). No mention of exploitation.

#CVE_2024_5027 #Citrix #vulnerability #CVE #PatchTuesday

screaminggoat at 2024-05-29T18:58:48.170Z ##

Mnemonic has observed attacker exploitation of CVE-2024-294919 as a zero-day (see above parent toot) since at least 30 April 2024:

mnemonic has observed attempts of exploitation in customer environments since April 30, 2024.

The following IOCs have been observed in customer environments between April 30, 2024, and today (May 29, 2024):

  • Reconnaissance IP: 82.180.133[.]120
  • Exploitation IP: 87.120.8[.]173
  • Exploitation IP: 23.227.203[.]36
  • Exploitation IP: 203.160.68[.]12

#zeroday #CVE_2024_24919 #eitw #activeexploitation #VPN #CheckPoint #vulnerability #cve #threatintel #IOC

DarkWebInformer at 2024-05-29T15:17:16.927Z ##

🚨POC RELEASED🚨CVE-2024-30056 Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Information Disclosure Vulnerability

#DarkWeb #Cybersecurity #Security #Cyberattack #Cybercrime #Privacy #Infosec #CVE202430056 #Vulnerability

This is a vulnerability in Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based). The attacker was able to trick the user into revealing sensitive information without his knowledge.

https://x.com/DarkWebInformer/status/1795836553207456099

##
DarkWebInformer@infosec.exchange at 2024-05-29T15:17:16.000Z ##

#DarkWeb #Cybersecurity #Security #Cyberattack #Cybercrime #Privacy #Infosec #CVE202430056 #Vulnerability

screaminggoat at 2024-05-24T15:12:26.375Z ##

Jenkins: Jenkins Security Advisory 2024-05-24
No mention of exploitation

  • CVE-2024-28793 (8.0 high) Stored XSS vulnerability in Team Concert Git Plugin
  • XXE vulnerabilities in OpenText Application Automation Tools Plugin
    • CVE-2024-4189 (7.1 high) LrScriptResultsParser.java
    • CVE-2024-4184 (7.1 high) XpathReader.java
    • CVE-2024-4690 (7.1 high) others
  • Missing permission checks in OpenText Application Automation Tools Plugin
    • CVE-2024-4211 (4.3 medium) ALM jobs configurations
    • CVE-2024-4691 (4.3 medium) ALM Octane configurations
    • CVE-2024-4692 (4.3 medium) Service Virtualization configurations
  • CVE-2024-5273 (4.3 medium) Path traversal vulnerability in Report Info Plugin

#Jenkins #PatchTuesday #CVE #vulnerability

  • XXE vulnerabilities in OpenText Application Automation Tools Plugin

    • CVE-2024-4184 (7.1 high) XpathReader.java
    • CVE-2024-4690 (7.1 high) others

    • CVE-2024-4691 (4.3 medium) ALM Octane configurations
    • CVE-2024-4692 (4.3 medium) Service Virtualization configurations

screaminggoat at 2024-05-24T15:12:26.375Z ##

Jenkins: Jenkins Security Advisory 2024-05-24
No mention of exploitation

  • CVE-2024-28793 (8.0 high) Stored XSS vulnerability in Team Concert Git Plugin
  • XXE vulnerabilities in OpenText Application Automation Tools Plugin
    • CVE-2024-4189 (7.1 high) LrScriptResultsParser.java
    • CVE-2024-4184 (7.1 high) XpathReader.java
    • CVE-2024-4690 (7.1 high) others
  • Missing permission checks in OpenText Application Automation Tools Plugin
    • CVE-2024-4211 (4.3 medium) ALM jobs configurations
    • CVE-2024-4691 (4.3 medium) ALM Octane configurations
    • CVE-2024-4692 (4.3 medium) Service Virtualization configurations
  • CVE-2024-5273 (4.3 medium) Path traversal vulnerability in Report Info Plugin

#Jenkins #PatchTuesday #CVE #vulnerability
